Threads database

Contains API for thread tracking. More...

Detailed Description

Function Documentation

VOID OS_DeregisterCurrentThread ( void   ) 

Deregister the current thread from the threads database and release all the resources used to track this thread (including TLS).

Availability:
  • O/S: Windows, Linux & OS X*
  • CPU: All

VOID OS_DeregisterThread ( NATIVE_TID  ntid  ) 

Deregister a thread from the threads database and release all the resources used to track this thread (including TLS).

Parameters:
[in] ntid OS thread ID of the thread to deregister.
Availability:
  • O/S: Windows, Linux & OS X*
  • CPU: All

PIN_TID OS_PinTidByNativeTid ( NATIVE_TID  ntid  ) 

Find the internal thread ID of a thread by its OS thread ID.

Parameters:
[in] ntid OS thread ID of the thread to look for.
Return values:
PIN_TID The internal thread ID of the thread or INVALID_PIN_TID if the thread wasn't found.
Availability:
  • O/S: Windows, Linux & OS X*
  • CPU: All

VOID OS_RegisterThread ( NATIVE_TID  ntid,
PIN_TID *  ptid 
)

Register a thread in the threads database.

Parameters:
[in] ntid OS thread ID of the thread to register.
[out] ptid Internal ID used to reference this thread in the DB.
Availability:
  • O/S: Windows, Linux & OS X*
  • CPU: All
